First Sovereign of Bengal

The Gauda kingdom, centered in modern Murshidabad (West Bengal), rose to prominence under Shashanka. Shashanka is often considered the first independent king of unified Bengal. After the decline of the Gupta Empire, he united various local chieftains under one banner to build a powerful kingdom, with its capital at Karnasuvarna.

тЪФя╕П
Rivalry with Harshavardhana

Shashanka is known in history as the fiercest rival of Emperor Harshavardhana and his Thanesar-Kannauj alliance. He treacherously assassinated Harsha's brother, Rajyavardhana. In Banabhatta's 'Harshacharita', Shashanka is portrayed as a villain, but he was undoubtedly a shrewd and courageous politician.

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Religious Controversy

Shashanka was a devout Shaivite (devotee of Shiva). Buddhist texts, such as the travelogue of Xuanzang, accuse him of persecuting Buddhists and cutting down the sacred Bodhi Tree in Bodh Gaya. While some modern historians may consider this an exaggeration due to religious bias, it reflects the intense religious-political tensions of the time.
